title: [Large-scale] Reflective Thinking Strategies Program for Improving Diagnostic Accuracy

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced scientific domain expertise and basic diagnostic technical skills
context.additional_context: Aimed at pre-service/in-service teachers, this course strengthens reflective thinking competencies when analyzing complex cases.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically apply reflective thinking strategies when analyzing complex scientific cases, improving diagnostic accuracy by over 20%
Learners reconstruct and understand core principles while explaining reflective thinking procedures to peer teachers
Learners can identify cognitive biases in new case diagnoses and generate three or more critical questions to minimize them

resources: Video Recording Equipment (for Virtual Peer Explanation)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
